title: Cloud Foundation Landing Zone
subtitle: Mini enterprise cloud foundation built as a personal project
one_liner: Mini enterprise cloud foundation built as a personal project
highlights: Identity boundary with least privilege roles
Hub and spoke or transit style networking with controlled traffic
Dev vs prod separation and blast radius thinking
proof: Screenshots of policies denying unsafe config
note: Hands on labs and build project, not job experience
goal: Build a minimal enterprise-style cloud foundation: identity boundaries, network segmentation, centralized logging, and policy guardrailsâ€”mapping AWS and Azure concepts.
architecture: Identity boundary with separate accounts/subscriptions and least-privilege roles
Hub-and-spoke or transit-style network with controlled egress and segmentation
Centralized logging (e.g. CloudWatch / Log Analytics) with queries and retention
Dev vs prod separation to limit blast radius
Policy guardrails (e.g. AWS Config / Azure Policy) to deny unsafe config
exercises: Define identity boundary and role model (IAM / RBAC)
Design hub-spoke or transit network and document traffic rules
Enable centralized logging and run sample queries
Enforce at least one policy that denies an unsafe action and capture evidence
Document architecture and Azure vs AWS concept mapping

title: Kubernetes Lab and Troubleshooting
